strapiEdition.headline: Tenants and Landlords to Get Some Relief

posts.title: Arkansas Fresh Start Program
posts.content:
Money from the CARES Act will support a new program that provides renters and landlords some relief in these uncertain times

  • Background – The Arkansas Fresh Start Program will help catch up renters who have fallen behind in payments. Renters are eligible for the program if they may 80% or less of the areas median income.
  • Deep Dive – the program is not currently accepting applications in Northwest Arkansas, but should be in “early November”

posts.title: Arkansas Covid Update
posts.content:
The United States may have had its ‘worst’ week of COVID.. The New York Times claim that the country hit its day record on Friday with 98,859 new cases confirmed.

  • Info – where does Arkansas stand within this list of new cases? Arkansas has an average of 963 cases per day, which is an increase of around 8% from the average two weeks prior. In perspective, this is within the lowest 10 states in the Union.
  • The Arkansas Governor tweeted on Sunday, “Be safe this week & let’s all do our part to stop the spread in our communities” – Governor Asa Hutchinson
